title: Collaborative Spatial Analysis and Digital Content Development for Achieving Sustainable Development Goals

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Understanding, Fundamental Wiki Editing Skills, and Statistical Data Processing Ability
context.additional_context: A program for mathematics majors to strengthen spatial data analysis and SDGs-linked competencies.

learning_goals: OpenStreetMap data can be utilized to analyze gender balance indicators in urban spaces with 85% accuracy

Learners can systematically edit three or more Wikipedia articles/categories using SDGs-related spatial data, link five or more internal references, and achieve over 80% on a digital citizenship rubric (data accuracy, editing coherence, collaboration participation).

Learners can build three or more mathematical models (e.g., graphs, matrices, differential equations) using spatial information (coordinates, distances, areas) collected during collaborative mapping and propose two solutions for sustainability issues (e.g., traffic congestion, energy efficiency) in a specific region.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
